com.discretix.drmdlc.api
Interface IDxDrmDlc

public interface IDxDrmDlc

This interface is used to access all the DRM oriented operations. This product contains technology subject to certain intellectual property rights of Microsoft. Use or distribution of this technology outside of this product is prohibited without the appropriate license(s) from Microsoft.

Author:
Discretix

Method Detail

personalizationVerify

boolean personalizationVerify()
Verify that the device has been personalized successfully and that the DRM library is operational. If this function fails, performing DRM operations (such as license-acquisition, content decryption, etc.) will not be possible.

For PlayReady, the function will verify that a device model certificate exists along with a matching private key. It will also verify that a certificate chain that leads to a self signed certificate was stored on the device.

Returns:
true if the device is personalized o/w false.

performPersonalization

void performPersonalization(java.lang.String appVersion,
                            java.lang.String serverUrl,
                            java.lang.String sessionId)
                            throws DrmNotSupportedException,
                                   DrmUpdateRequiredException,
                                   DrmGeneralFailureException,
                                   java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                   DrmCommunicationFailureException
Start a personalization process. This process that is responsible for providing the device assets required by the DRM library. pay attention that this function also automatically deletes the existing secure store use personalizationVerify to avoid such situation. Note: This is a blocking function and should not be called from the UI thread.

Parameters:
appVersion - The version name of the Application using the DxDrmDlc interface.
serverUrl - The personalization server address
sessionId - Custom data that will be passed to the personalization server
Throws:
DrmNotSupportedException
DrmUpdateRequiredException
DrmGeneralFailureException
java.lang.NullPointerException - if serverUrl is null
DrmCommunicationFailureException

importDrmObject

@Deprecated
void importDrmObject(java.lang.String fileName)
                     throws DrmGeneralFailureException,
                            java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                            DrmServerSoapErrorException,
                            DrmCommunicationFailureException
Deprecated. 

This method is replaced by: executeInitiator(String) Introduce a new DRM object that is stored in fileName to the DRM system. The import process might involve HTTP operations performed by the DRM library. For PlayReady, This function is used to process PlayReady initiator XML files. Note: This is a blocking function and should not be called from the UI thread.

Parameters:
fileName - name of the content file or content URI.
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
DrmServerSoapErrorException
DrmCommunicationFailureException

importDrmObject

@Deprecated
void importDrmObject(android.net.Uri uri)
                     throws DrmGeneralFailureException,
                            java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                            DrmServerSoapErrorException,
                            DrmCommunicationFailureException
Deprecated. 

This method is replaced by: executeInitiator(Uri) Introduce a new DRM object that is pointed by a URI to the DRM system. The import process might involve HTTP operations performed by the DRM library. For PlayReady, This function is used to process PlayReady initiator URL. Note: This is a blocking function and should not be called from the UI thread.

Parameters:
uri - the Content URI of the data you want to open (may be a URL address).
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
DrmServerSoapErrorException
DrmCommunicationFailureException

isDrmContent

boolean isDrmContent(java.lang.String fileName)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Check if the content pointed by filename is DRM protected

Parameters:
fileName - full path to the content file.
Returns:
true if content is DRM protected o/w false
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

isDrmContent

boolean isDrmContent(android.content.Context context,
                     android.net.Uri uri)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Check if the content pointed by a URI is DRM protected

Parameters:
context - the Context to use when resolving the Uri
uri - the Content URI of the data whose rights should be consumed
Returns:
true if content is DRM protected o/w false
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

getRightsInfo

IDxRightsInfo[] getRightsInfo(android.content.Context context,
                              android.net.Uri uri)
                              throws DrmGeneralFailureException,
                                     java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                     DrmNotProtectedException,
                                     DrmInvalidFormatException,
                                     java.io.IOException,
                                     DrmCommunicationFailureException
Retrieve an array of IDxRightsInfo objects that describe the rights available for the specified file. If no rights are available null will be returned.

Parameters:
context - the Context to use when resolving the Uri.
uri - the URI of either the content, the license info of which is required, or the corresponding initiator.
Returns:
array of IDxRightsInfo objects
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
DrmNotProtectedException
DrmInvalidFormatException
java.io.IOException
DrmCommunicationFailureException

verifyRights

boolean verifyRights(android.content.Context context,
                     android.net.Uri uri)
                     throws DrmInvalidFormatException,
                            DrmGeneralFailureException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                            java.io.IOException
Verify that the file specified by a Uri has valid rights. This function does not check if the file is a DRM file.

Parameters:
context - the Context to use for resolving the URI.
uri - the URI of either the content, the rights of which should be verified, or the corresponding initiator.

Do not pass a URL, it must be a file

Returns:
True if file is DRM content with rights, else False.
Throws:
DrmInvalidFormatException
DrmGeneralFailureException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.io.IOException

                     throws DrmInvalidFormatException,

                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                            java.io.IOException

Parameters:

Returns:
True if file is DRM content with rights, else False.

acquireRights

void acquireRights(java.lang.String fileName,
                   java.lang.String customData,
                   java.lang.String rightsUrl)
                   throws DrmGeneralFailureException,
                          java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                          DrmNotProtectedException,
                          DrmInvalidFormatException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          DrmServerSoapErrorException,
                          DrmCommunicationFailureException
Acquire rights for the file specified by fileName. It attempts a silent rights acquisition based on the data available in the file DRM header. Note: This is a blocking function and should not be called from the UI thread.

Parameters:
fileName - full path to the content file.
customData - Optional string that will be passed to the license server via the license acquisition protocol. If no customData is used then null value should be placed in this parameter.
rightsUrl - Optional string that will override the LA-URL embedded within the content header. If no rightsUrl is used then null value should be placed in this parameter.
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
DrmNotProtectedException
DrmInvalidFormatException
java.io.IOException
DrmServerSoapErrorException
DrmCommunicationFailureException

acquireRights

void acquireRights(android.content.Context context,
                   android.net.Uri contentUri,
                   java.lang.String customData,
                   java.lang.String rightsUrl)
                   throws DrmGeneralFailureException,
                          java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                          DrmNotProtectedException,
                          DrmInvalidFormatException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          DrmServerSoapErrorException,
                          DrmCommunicationFailureException
Acquire rights for the file specified by a Uri. It attempts a silent rights acquisition based on the data available in the file DRM header. Note: This is a blocking function and should not be called from the UI thread.

Parameters:
context - the Context to use for resolving the URI.
contentUri - full path to the content file. file must reside on the local file system.
customData - Optional string that will be passed to the license server via the license acquisition protocol. If no customData is used then null value should be placed in this parameter.
rightsUrl - Optional string that will override the LA-URL embedded within the content header. If no rightsUrl is used then null value should be placed in this parameter.
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
DrmNotProtectedException
DrmInvalidFormatException
java.io.IOException
DrmServerSoapErrorException
DrmCommunicationFailureException

setCookies

void setCookies(java.lang.String[] cookies)
Once setCookies is called every "acquireRights" or "executeInitiator" will attach a cookie header to the HTTP request which contains the cookies. To clear the cookies just call setCookies(null). The cookies will be separated by "; " (semi-colon and white-space) The final header will be as follow: "cookie = ; ; ..." Note: *This function is not thread safe.

Parameters:
cookies - The array of cookies to be sent.

setConfigurationParams

void setConfigurationParams(EDxConfigurationParams configParam,
                            int value)
Option to configure SDK parameters. Parameters to configure: 1. DX_DRM_OPERATION_NETWORK_TIMEOUT set the timeout for http agents in seconds. Default value: 60 seconds. Valid range: 5-300 seconds.

Parameters:
configParam - - the parameter to configure
value -

executeInitiator

void executeInitiator(java.lang.String fileName)
                      throws DrmGeneralFailureException,
                             java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                             DrmServerSoapErrorException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             DrmCommunicationFailureException
Execute a PlayReady Initiator file. Initiators may be used for license acquisition, join/leave domain and metering. A combined initiator can contain one or more of the above. Note: This is a blocking function and should not be called from the UI thread.

Parameters:
fileName - Full path to the local initiator file.
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
DrmServerSoapErrorException
DrmCommunicationFailureException

executeInitiator

void executeInitiator(android.net.Uri uri)
                      throws DrmGeneralFailureException,
                             java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                             DrmServerSoapErrorException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             DrmCommunicationFailureException
Execute a PlayReady Initiator file. Initiators may be used for license acquisition, join/leave domain and metering. A combined initiator can contain one or more of the above. Note: This is a blocking function and should not be called from the UI thread.

Parameters:
uri - The URI of the initiator to be executed (may be a URL address).
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
DrmServerSoapErrorException
DrmCommunicationFailureException

generatePersonalizationChallenge

IDxChallenge generatePersonalizationChallenge(java.lang.String appVersion,
                                              java.lang.String sessionId)
                                              throws DrmGeneralFailureException
Generates a personalization challenge. The function returns IDxChallenge that enables handling the Personalization server response. The IdxChallenge is valid as long as the IDxDrmDlc is alive. Terminating the IDxDrmDlc invalidates the IDxChallenge and it will not be able to handle the response correctly. Therefore the IDxDrmDlc must remain in memory until the response from the server is handled. Generate another personalization challenge also cause the privies one to be invalid. Do not use the performPersonalization method in parallel of using this challenge method

Parameters:
appVersion - The version name of the Application using the DxDrmDlc interface.
sessionId - Custom data that will be passed to the personalization server
Returns:
IDxChallenge that represents the generated challenge
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException

generateChallengeFromInitiator

IDxChallenge generateChallengeFromInitiator(java.lang.String initiatorPath)
                                            throws DrmGeneralFailureException
Generates a challenge from a PlayReady Initiator file.
The type of the generated challenge will depend on the type of the initiator.

Parameters:
initiatorPath - Full path to the local initiator file.
Returns:
IDxChallenge that represents the generated challenge
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException

IDxChallenge that represents the generated challenge

DrmGeneralFailureException

                                                   throws DrmGeneralFailureException
Generates a License Acquisition challenge from a PlayReady header.

Parameters:
drmHeader - The PlayReady header.
Returns:
IDxChallenge that represents the generated challenge

DrmGeneralFailureException

                                       throws DrmGeneralFailureException

Returns:
IDxChallenge that represents the generated challenge
Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException

verifySecClockSet

boolean verifySecClockSet()
Verifies whether the secure clock is set.
If this function returns false, the secure clock has to be set via API before any other DRM operation.

Returns:
true - if the secure clock is set,
false - otherwise

performSecClockSet

void performSecClockSet()
                        throws DrmGeneralFailureException,
                               DrmServerSoapErrorException,
                               DrmHttpAuthenticationRequired,
                               DrmCommunicationFailureException
Sets the secure clock required for normal operation of DRM operations.

Throws:
DrmGeneralFailureException
DrmServerSoapErrorException
DrmHttpAuthenticationRequired
DrmCommunicationFailureException

Drm Version name.

getDeviceID

java.lang.String getDeviceID()
Retrieves a device unique ID as UTF8 encoded string. This ID is based on device specific information.

Returns:
The device unique ID as UTF8 encoded string

getDebugInterface

IDxDrmDlcDebug getDebugInterface()
Return a debug interface. The interface object can be used for operations such as: - Logging activation - Personalization deletion - etc.

Returns:
IDxDrmDlcDebug
